result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert H Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Robert H
defendant.address: 1547 Egg Harbor Road, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert H Peterson in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read case in for sentencing in case no. 15-CM-174. Court dismisses case with the understanding that it can be considered for sentencing purposes in case no. 15-CM-174.
Defendant is working at Therm-Tron-X through Superior Resources

Defendant Robert H Peterson in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
E-mails between Atty Crowell and JA re: rescheduling

Defendant was arrested on bail jumping charges over the weekend. During bond hearing on 10/19, Judge Ehlers appointed Travis Crowell to represent Defendant on this file and new charges, ordered Defendant to pay $150 per month.
Defendant called, wondered if he's allowed input into which attorney gets appointed. Clerk advised him to put request in writing.
Court appoints Stephen Johnson, orders repayment of $125 per month starting 11/13/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No violent contact with SB. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Robert H Peterson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants Court-appointed Counsel, does not qualify for PD. Defendant needs time to contact attorneys. Court reviews options.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
